commit_message:
Use instance.project_id when creating request specs for old instances

The online data migration routine to create request specs for old
instances is using an admin context, which doesn't have a project_id
set, which means the request spec that gets created doesn't have
a project_id set, which matters when the FilterScheduler tries to
claim resources (create allocations in Placement) using said
request spec's project_id (PUT /allocations requires a non-null
project_id).

This fixes the online data migration by creating the request spec
using the instance's project_id rather than that from the context.

Change-Id: I214a44f0eee7d90be5cd89f32f6e0017b19a3fd6
Partial-Bug: #1739318
(cherry picked from commit a148e638dd5eaaa6f9c8749782a625c6523b6b6a)

commit_message:
Switch to pep8 jobs for manila-specs

With the move to zuulv3, the openstack-tox-py* job
definitions ignore doc only changes, so we have dropped
triggering doc checks from the py27,py35 targets and
are instead running doc8 against the spec directory from
the pep8 target.

Switch the configure check and gate jobs to run pep8
so that we can catch and prevent formatting errors in
new specs.

Change-Id: Ie01d83ab3c022057281b080f6822d644a0cf57e9
Depends-On: I82c8dbec713fc5575fd03c0ae290bf190bbdf8ca

commit_message:
Added openstack-tempest-plugins job template

* Since due to tempest plugin goals, we have more than 20 plugins
  and each of them are using same type of jobs. So it is better to
  unify them and use it.

commit_message:
cleanup data collection admin guide

- remove list of notifications used for meters, it's not accurate
and is arguably of no value to an administrator even if it's
accurate. just list where the endpoints are and how to configure.
- remove comments about database connection, this means nothing
- remove libvirt comment, listing all services polled as these are
stated elsewhere and are just repeated.

Change-Id: If67ecf7e507da70abae3734618358c2458f49037
(cherry picked from commit d5a89cd997b25b5aab286377a8f058f38c36c736)

The following table contains the event types by each OpenStack service that Telemetry transforms into samples. .. list-table:: :widths: 10 15 30 :header-rows: 1 * - OpenStack service - Event types - Note * - OpenStack Compute - scheduler.run\_instance.scheduled scheduler.select\_\ destinations compute.instance.\* - For a more detailed list of Compute notifications please check the `System Usage Data wiki page <https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ SystemUsageData>`__. * - Bare metal service - hardware.ipmi.\* - * - OpenStack Image - image.update image.upload image.delete image.send - The required configuration for Image service can be found in the `Configure the Image service for Telemetry <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/telemetry/ocata>`__ section in the Installation Tutorials and Guides. * - OpenStack Networking - floatingip.create.end floatingip.update.\* floatingip.exists network.create.end network.update.\* network.exists port.create.end port.update.\* port.exists router.create.end router.update.\* router.exists subnet.create.end subnet.update.\* subnet.exists l3.meter - * - Orchestration service - orchestration.stack\ .create.end orchestration.stack\ .update.end orchestration.stack\ .delete.end orchestration.stack\ .resume.end orchestration.stack\ .suspend.end - * - OpenStack Block Storage - volume.exists volume.create.\* volume.delete.\* volume.update.\* volume.resize.\* volume.attach.\* volume.detach.\* snapshot.exists snapshot.create.\* snapshot.delete.\* snapshot.update.\* volume.backup.create.\ \* volume.backup.delete.\ \* volume.backup.restore.\ \* - The required configuration for Block Storage service can be found in the `Add the Block Storage service agent for Telemetry <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/telemetry/ocata/cinder/install-cinder-ubuntu.html>`__ section in the Installation Tutorials and Guides. notifications using the correct control exchange on the message queue and so forth. These configuration needs are referred in the above table for each OpenStack service that needs it. Specific notifications from the Compute service are important for administrators and users. Configuring ``nova_notifications`` in the ``nova.conf`` file allows administrators to respond to events rapidly. For more information on configuring notifications for the compute service, see `Telemetry services <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/telemetry/ocata/install-compute-ubuntu.html>`__ in the Installation Tutorials and Guides.node, installation instructions can be found in the `Install the Compute agent for Telemetry <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/telemetry/ocata/install-compute-ubuntu.html>`__The compute agent does not need direct database connection. The samples collected by this agent are sent via AMQP to the notification agent to be processed. .. note:: Telemetry supports Libvirt, which hides the hypervisor under it. The following services can be polled with this agent:- Energy consumption meters via `Kwapi <https://launchpad.net/kwapi>`__ framework (deprecated in Newton) To install and configure this service use the `Add the Telemetry service <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/telemetry/ocata/install-base-ubuntu.html>`__Just like the compute agent, this component also does not need a direct database connection. The samples are sent via AMQP to the notification agent. Just like the central agent, this component also does not need direct database access. The samples are sent via AMQP to the notification agent.

subject: Log TokenNotFound at INFO level instead of WARNING
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-14 23:47:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystonemiddleware/commit/cd2576e4aa66b0ee9ef634f22410fab91c1ce0e2', 'message': 'Log TokenNotFound at INFO level instead of WARNING

Token expiration is normal, however the client logs fill up with these
ominous WARNING messages:

WARNING keystonemiddleware.auth_token [-] Authorization failed for token
WARNING keystonemiddleware.auth_token [-] Identity response: {"error": {"message": "Could not find token: 24ffb14540c74a7c964f9627fe2af8fb", "code": 404, "title": "Not Found"}}

It seems more useful to log normal events at a level less than WARNING,
this would reduce the log size but more importantly it will help
elminate the concerns raised when logs are filled with WARNING messages
that are otherwise benign.

commit_message:
Log TokenNotFound at INFO level instead of WARNING

Token expiration is normal, however the client logs fill up with these
ominous WARNING messages:

WARNING keystonemiddleware.auth_token [-] Authorization failed for token
WARNING keystonemiddleware.auth_token [-] Identity response: {"error": {"message": "Could not find token: 24ffb14540c74a7c964f9627fe2af8fb", "code": 404, "title": "Not Found"}}

It seems more useful to log normal events at a level less than WARNING,
this would reduce the log size but more importantly it will help
elminate the concerns raised when logs are filled with WARNING messages
that are otherwise benign.

Change-Id: I54ad6b5530ee81616bd4a44f8295985f5d84c2ee
Closes-Bug: #1738300
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystonemiddleware refs/changes/29/528129/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Extract netmiko device configuration save

The configuration save operation of netmiko devices is extracted into a
separate function. This allows devices to implement the function as
required, or to use the base class's implementation.

Change-Id: I135ccb842a1120b099afe1107da7b549bad943ef
Related-Bug: #1740587

commit_message:
Openstack metrics exporter for prometheus

This exporter provides a means for Prometheus to gather openstack
service metrics related to overlying openstack-helm deployments
Change-Id: I5f1789c62b4547add0c67edb51540f712bf43da8

commit_message:
Pass network_id to device's del_network method

This allows devices which reference VLANs by name and not ID
(such as Juniper Junos devices) to delete networks by name, which
is their neutron ID.

Change-Id: If1257fad47d05016dc59a8cfc60f5d2d22be420c
Related-Bug: #1740587

subject: add bluestore-specific config options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-24 22:56:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd/commit/4cda94b9f9606a455b7a5047451264aa9191b371', 'message': "add bluestore-specific config options

Adds bluestore-specific options related to the metadata-only journal.

the 'experimental' option is no longer needed
https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/luminous/src/common/legacy_config_opts.h#L79

It also has been dropped from example configs
https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commit/fdd81ccf758b9fba25967094ef7a9b4d35f57a10

The options allow a user to control:

1. path to a bluestore wal (block special file or regular file)
2. path to a bluestore db (block special file or regular file)
3. size of both

Their configuration works similarly to the FileStore journal. If paths
are not specified both WAL and DB will be collocated on the same block
device as data.

Other options can be configured via an existing config-flags option if needed.
http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/rados/configuration/bluestore-config-ref/

Change-Id: Ia85092230d4dcb0435354deb276012f923547393
Depends-On: I483ee9dae4ce69c71ae06359d0fb96aaa1c56cbc

commit_message:
add bluestore-specific config options

Adds bluestore-specific options related to the metadata-only journal.

The options allow a user to control:

1. path to a bluestore wal (block special file or regular file)
2. path to a bluestore db (block special file or regular file)
3. size of both

Their configuration works similarly to the FileStore journal. If paths
are not specified both WAL and DB will be collocated on the same block
device as data.

Other options can be configured via an existing config-flags option if needed.
http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/rados/configuration/bluestore-config-ref/

Closes-Bug: #1710474
Change-Id: Ia85092230d4dcb0435354deb276012f923547393
Depends-On: I483ee9dae4ce69c71ae06359d0fb96aaa1c56cbc
Depends-On: Idbbb69acec92b2f2efca80691ca73a2030bcf633

commit_message:
Ingress: Allow annotations to be dyanmicly driven

This PS allows the ingress rules to be dynamicly driven from the
values.yaml, permitting the ingress cotnroller to ba changed and
custom rules to be applied: eg whitelisting of clients.

Change-Id: Ica6b4692ff9b6b77d1efe6bae212a1227e56ca66

commit_message:
Use correct raw string format

You're not supposed to just randomly put backslashes in front of other
characters that don't need escaping unless it's a raw string. This is
deprecated in Python 3.6.

Change-Id: I7a69ba6dd10412bb065f2b6ba405840d0a98663a

commit_message:
WIP Remove keystoneclient.session usage

This change removes all usage of keystoneclient.session
which has been long deprecated, and replaces it with
keystoneauth1.session.

Change-Id: I3cf345e3396a098b678364bfa3985f9eb3c36f83

commit_message:
Libvirt: move configuration to be generated directly from values

This PS moves the configuration files used by libvirt to be
generated directly from the values, rather than being templated.

Change-Id: I8ab2783c9d1d5d815cc02eccafa21058ff3acead

commit_message:
Perserve env variables

This patch set adds in -E flag for ``sudo pip install`` so
any environment variable is preserved for the install.  This allows
for some proxy-related variables such as ``http_proxy`` to pass
through for pip.

Change-Id: I89881d811b53b27e2663a40c1c96fcf18e614b00
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/70/531270/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo -H -E pip install --upgrade pip sudo -H -E pip install --upgrade setuptools sudo -H -E pip install pyyaml sudo -H -E pip install yq
deleted_lines: sudo -H pip install --upgrade pip sudo -H pip install --upgrade setuptools sudo -H pip install pyyaml sudo -H pip install yq

commit_message:
Fix error message in the manage API

When the manage API is called on a particular share without specifying
the share type and the also the default share type is not found, the API
raises an error message which contains the share_type_id of default
sharetype which is not existant. The error message which should be
displayed is "Default share type not found.". The fix for this bug is
to change the parameters sent to the ShareTypeNotFound class, changing
it from ShareTypeNotFound(reason=msg) to ShareTypeNotFound(message=msg).

**Previously:
manila manage \
stack-VirtualBox@prague#lvm-single-pool \
NFS \
127.0.0.1:/opt/stack/data/manila/mnt/share-2cd5d0de-994b-4cbf-bf55-9808e
49266f0
ERROR: Share type %(share_type_id)s could not be found.

**Now:
manila manage \
stack-VirtualBox@prague#lvm-single-pool \
NFS \
127.0.0.1:/opt/stack/data/manila/mnt/share-2cd5d0de-994b-4cbf-bf55-9808e
49266f0
ERROR: Default share type not found.

Closes-Bug: #1705533
Change-Id: I36a76a93b7d0f54c1e9aec43e332cb94b0b389f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/60/530960/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class DefaultShareTypeNotFound(NotFound): message = _("%(reason)s")

commit_message:
WIP copy tripleo-ansible-inventory for CI jobs

Note this uses a find/wildcard because
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/530477/ changes the filename
to add a .yaml extension, this should handle old/new naming.

Change-Id: I7e0d053147fafd933f6e5e11bdf70e39260d5358

added_lines: - name: Find ansible inventory file for jobs which create it find: paths: "/tmp" patterns: "tripleo-ansible-inventory*" recurse: "yes" file_type: "file" register: find_result - name: Fetch ansible inventory file for jobs which create it shell: > cp {{ item }} {{ artcl_collect_dir }}/ with_items: "{{ find_result.files }}"

subject: Add env vars to set the RAM for VMS in the mnaio
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-03 23:17:40.000000000', 'files': ['multi-node-aio/README.rst', 'multi-node-aio/build.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops/commit/7fbc50c036569256e08c22a138907e35cb66fbf3', 'message': 'Add env vars to set the RAM for VMS in the mnaio

The MNAIO serves as a good way to play with a production like OSA
environment on minimal hardware. While this is a good way to test it
does leave some options hard to address and change when trying to build
in an automated way. This change makes it possible for a deployer to set
an environmental variable to change the ram allocation of all default vm
types which should help folks build a more capable and customizable test
cloud.

Change-Id: Idc2cff091701ecda80165a98fffa1db222600d27
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add env vars to set the RAM for VMS in the mnaio

The MNAIO serves as a good way to play with a production like OSA
environment on minimal hardware. While this is a good way to test it
does leave some options hard to address and change when trying to build
in an automated way. This change makes it possible for a deployer to set
an environmental variable to change the ram allocation of all default vm
types which should help folks build a more capable and customizable test
cloud.

Change-Id: Idc2cff091701ecda80165a98fffa1db222600d27
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

added_lines: -e cinder_vm_server_ram=${CINDER_VM_SERVER_RAM-"2048"} \ -e compute_vm_server_ram=${COMPUTE_VM_SERVER_RAM-"8196"} \ -e infra_vm_server_ram=${INFRA_VM_SERVER_RAM-"8196"} \ -e loadbalancer_vm_server_ram=${LOADBALANCER_VM_SERVER_RAM-"1024"} \ -e logging_vm_server_ram=${LOGGING_VM_SERVER_RAM-"1024"} \ -e swift_vm_server_ram=${SWIFT_VM_SERVER_RAM-"1024"} \

commit_message:
Log by default all output of quickstart.sh

Log everything from quickstart.sh by default into _quickstart.log
for future investigations, bug reports, etc.
Add force color in case of interactive shell, because it doesn't
color output in subshell by default.

Change-Id: I1780785fee32d2a5c8eca77cf0becea7a5342220
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/05/530305/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Show colored output if running interactively if [ -t 1 ] ; then export ANSIBLE_FORCE_COLOR=true fi # Log everything from this script into _quickstart.log exec &> >(tee -i _quickstart.log )

commit_message:
Include security_compliance manifest in keystone

This enables us to configure the security compliance options through
t-h-t.

Depends-On: Ic4d962910343ad30de7840124bbc7773ea3697a1
Change-Id: I089f2e28cce2688ed080096c88ab539393627cfb

added_lines: --- features: - | The security compliance manifest was included in the keystone profile. This enables us to configure the security compliance options through t-h-t.

commit_message:
Force IPSEC connection initiation between hosts

This prevents other services from experiencing timeouts due to the
tunnels being lazily initiated.

Change-Id: Ic21f38938e21472c42d6cf70787124f9468d46ea

Add an external infoblox sample file.

added_lines: - name: pool-1 # The name is immutable. There will be no option to change the name after # creation and the only way will to change it will be to delete it # (and all zones associated with it) and recreate it. description: Default Infoblox Pool attributes: internal: true # List out the NS records for zones hosted within this pool ns_records: - hostname: ns1-1.example.org. priority: 1 # List out the nameservers for this pool. These are the actual Infoblox # servers. We use these to verify changes have propagated to all nameservers. nameservers: - host: 192.0.2.2 port: 53 # List out the targets for this pool. For Infoblox, most often, there will be one # entry for each Infoblox server. targets: - type: infoblox description: Infoblox Server # List out the targets for this pool. For Infoblox, most often, there will be one # entry for each Infoblox server. masters: - host: 192.0.2.2 port: 53 # Infoblox Configuration options options: host: 192.0.2.2 port: 53 http_pool_maxsize: 100 http_pool_connections: 100 wapi_url: https://192.0.2.2/wapi/v2.1/ sslverify: false password: infoblox username: admin multi_tenant: false ns_group: openstack

commit_message:
Pass data to hacluster charm using JSON

Encode dicts passed to hacluster charm using JSON serialization,
supporting consistent data presentation under Python 3 where
dict key iteration is non-deterministic.

This is supported by prefixing json based data items with 'json_'
and encoding with keys sorted.

The charm will also clear any unprefixed based data items for
upgrades.

Change-Id: I21c6acff4a4a22cbcc5e6ea4e78394ce076e79d9
Closes-Bug: 1741304
Depends-On: I364a60ca7b91327fe88ee729cf49ff8ab3f5e2b6

commit_message:
Adds SR-IOV support

In order to use SR-IOV on a compute node, the feature has
to be enabled and supported by the OS and the NICs.

The nova-compute service will report the SR-IOV VFs as
PCI devices. SR-IOV is requested by creating a neutron port with
the binding:vnic_type direct.

The Hyper-V Mechanism Driver already supports ports with vnic_type direct,
so no changes are necessary to it.

An SR-IOV neutron port will contain the pci_slot in the port's profile.
When can use that information in order to determine whether SR-IOV has to
be enabled or not.

Depends-On: Ied27bb4e1b36e743b33c6b65351c2ee942ef535e

commit_message:
use format{v4,v6} options for Newton+

format option was removed in Pike but added in Newton - we need an
appropriate template for that while preserving Mitaka compatibility
https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/designate/pike.html#critical-issues

Change-Id: Ib5cb4bd79aba6ca37b21b8f0942bb09f9341d328
Closes-Bug: #1733079

commit_message:
Add native Zuul v3 bindep fallback tests

For project-config itself, use native Zuul v3 tests for testing that we
can install the bindep list for the used distributions.

Note that the new job does not run if the local bindep.txt file or
other-requirements.txt is changed since those files are irreleant for
this test. This test only tests jenkins/data/bindep-fallback.txt.

Since project-config is trusted, we cannot directly test that the jobs
work. Therefore add them as experimental - and then test that they work.
A followup change will then use these jobs by default.

Change-Id: Ia95b73aa955a07840ce9b66ba36a6da821e1d34c

a single one instead.

commit_message:
Handle InvalidVolume when creating a volume attachment

If you try to attach a non-multiattach volume to more than
once instance using the 3.27 volume attachments API, the volume
API would return a 500 response because the volume is in-use.

This translates to a 500 in the compute API because nova isn't
expecting a random client exception.

Treat this like how os-reserve could fail in the same situation
and handle InvalidVolume which will be converted to an HTTPBadRequest
by ResourceExceptionHandler elsewhere in the WSGi stack.

Change-Id: I1a8068043159b034d700419675af87fc17e1faf5
Closes-Bug: #1741112
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/11/531011/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Change-Id: I0233d1560169605be8aa51a79d0e71ff596568ea
'}]
commit_message:
Library policy for tag-based network security zone

Change-Id: I0233d1560169605be8aa51a79d0e71ff596568ea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/45/527545/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- name: TagBasedNetworkSecurityZone description: "By default, servers in different projects are isolated from each other. This policy allows servers tagged with the same security tag to communicate freely with each other. Limitation: this policy assumes each server has exactly one network port; the policy can be generalized to support servers with multiple network ports." # This library policy offers some of the functionality of # 'Application Based Policies' outlined in the VMware NSX whitepaper linked below. # https://www.vmware.com/content/dam/digitalmarketing/vmware/en/pdf/whitepaper/nsx/whitepaper-dfw-policy-rules-configuration-guide.pdf rules: - comment: "(customize) Define the Nova server tags used for tag-based security zones" rule: > security_zone_tags('demo_zone') - comment: "(customize) Define the Nova server tags used for tag-based security zones" rule: > security_zone_tags('production_zone') - comment: "(customize) Specify the name of the project that shall own the security groups used to implement this security policy. Default is 'admin'. Assumes project names are unique." rule: > admin_project_id(id) :- keystonev3:projects(name="admin", id=id) - comment: "Place servers in security zones based on the tags" rule: > server_security_zone(server_id, tag) :- nova:tags(server_id=server_id, tag=tag), security_zone_tags(tag) - comment: "Create special security group for each security zone" rule: > execute[neutronv2:create_security_group(zone, json)] :- zone_missing_sg(zone), admin_project_id(project_id), builtin:concat('{"security_group": {"name": "', zone, j1), builtin:concat(j1, '", "project_id": "', j2), builtin:concat(j2, project_id, j3), builtin:concat(j3, '", "description": "security group for security zone"}}', json) - comment: "Show error if security group missing for security zone" rule: > error(zone, "all servers", "no zone security group") :- zone_missing_sg(zone) - comment: "Bind each security-zone-tagged server to the appropriate security group" rule: > execute[neutronv2:attach_port_security_group(sg_id, port_id)] :- server_has_no_expected_group(server_id), server_security_zone(server_id, zone), neutronv2:security_groups(id=sg_id, name=zone, tenant_id=project_id), neutronv2:ports(id=port_id, device_id=server_id), admin_project_id(project_id) - comment: "Show error if security-zone-tagged server is not bound to appropriate security group" rule: > error(zone, server_id, "server missing zone security group") :- server_has_no_expected_group(server_id), server_security_zone(server_id, zone) # Rules below define all the additional helper tables that support rules above - rule: > server_has_no_expected_group(server_id) :- server_security_zone(server_id, _), NOT server_has_group(server_id) - rule: > server_has_group(server_id) :- server_to_zone_sg(server_id, _) - rule: > server_to_zone_sg(server_id, sg_id) :- device_to_sg(server_id, sg_id), server_security_zone(server_id, zone), neutronv2:security_groups(id=sg_ig, name=zone, tenant_id=project_id), admin_project_id(project_id) - rule: > device_to_sg(device_id, sg_id) :- neutronv2:security_group_port_bindings(port_id=port_id, security_group_id=sg_id), neutronv2:ports(id=port_id, device_id=device_id) - rule: > zone_missing_sg(zone) :- server_security_zone(_, zone), NOT security_group_names(zone) - rule: > security_group_names(sg_name) :- neutronv2:security_groups(name=sg_name, tenant_id=project_id), admin_project_id(project_id)

commit_message:
Switch Glance-related tests (dashboards.project.images) to mock

Some duplicated test scenarios were deleted. This patch also doesn't
change Selenium tests because it's out of scope of unit tests.

This patch changes mox to mock for the following test module:
* openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/tests.py
* openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/images/tests.py
* openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/tests.py

Change-Id: I951c2e5ee1c133faa2106e1e1fdba5c72d6f63b7
Partially-Implements: blueprint mock-framework-in-unit-tests

commit_message:
Support use of json for relation data

In order to provide consistent presentation of relation data
in Python 3 based charms, support passing of data using JSON
format which ensures that data on relations won't continually
change due to non-deterministic dictionary iteration in py3.

Change-Id: I364a60ca7b91327fe88ee729cf49ff8ab3f5e2b6
Closes-Bug: 1741304

added_lines: import json @mock.patch.object(utils, 'relation_get') def test_parse_data_legacy(self, relation_get): _rel_data = { 'testkey': repr({'test': 1}) } relation_get.side_effect = lambda key, relid, unit: _rel_data.get(key) self.assertEqual(utils.parse_data('hacluster:1', 'neutron-api/0', 'testkey'), {'test': 1}) relation_get.assert_has_calls([ mock.call('json_testkey', 'neutron-api/0', 'hacluster:1'), mock.call('testkey', 'neutron-api/0', 'hacluster:1'), ]) @mock.patch.object(utils, 'relation_get') def test_parse_data_json(self, relation_get): _rel_data = { 'json_testkey': json.dumps({'test': 1}), 'testkey': repr({'test': 1}) } relation_get.side_effect = lambda key, relid, unit: _rel_data.get(key) self.assertEqual(utils.parse_data('hacluster:1', 'neutron-api/0', 'testkey'), {'test': 1}) # NOTE(jamespage): as json is the preferred format, the call for # testkey should not occur. relation_get.assert_has_calls([ mock.call('json_testkey', 'neutron-api/0', 'hacluster:1'), ])

commit_message:
Remove bundled intree trove tempest plugin

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527122/ moves the intree
  tempest plugin to a new repo trove-tempest-plugin. Let'use
  it for the same.

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/530024/ consumes new trove
  tempest plugin in python-troveclient

Change-Id: I59aafa0ec978033ba4add2bc2a2144d177afb9ac

commit_message:
Allow ports filtering with device_id

Right now, if a neutron port is owned by a container powered by
Kuryr, there is no way to list and filter those ports because
OSC assumed a neutron port is owned by either a server or router.
This patch adds support for that by introducing an option '--device-id'
to the 'port list' command.

Change-Id: Ib1fd27e8d843a99fb02ccabd8a12a24ac27cec9c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/98/526798/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: device_group.add_argument( '--device-id', metavar='<device-id>', help=_("List only ports with the specified device ID") ) if parsed_args.device_id is not None: filters['device_id'] = parsed_args.device_id

add the _extra directory to the build instructions

Without the html_extra_path setting the .htaccess file is not copied
into the build directory.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Apply (voluntarily) the maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-29 10:47:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/f1d2ab05a59a9114be896e9313d7937cee7de7f0', 'message': 'Apply (voluntarily) the maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project

This commit is a request to the TC to consider the application of the
maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project.

We are far enough along in the Pike release, and there is sufficient
confidence that the project team will be able to release a version of
Trove as part of the Pike release.

This request is that the maintenance-mode tag be applied to the
project for the reasons described below.

The 'maintenance-mode' tag is meant to signify that a project is in a
transient period of low activity. Here are some numbers that
illustrate this.

Release       LOC
---------------------
IceHouse      43,728
Juno          66,364
Kilo          45,825
Liberty       68,490
Mitaka        74,622
Newton        79,686
Ocata         53,513
Pike          31,150

The reasons for this are well known and I am not going to dwell upon
them here; they were the subject of discussion when the tag was
proposed [1], and when it was discussed by the TC.

When this tag was created, it had been the plan that it would
immediately be applied to the Trove project but after discussing this
with several people in the community, it was agreed that we would wait
a release cycle and see what if anything changed during that period of
time.

While the number of commits has decreased (about 50%), and the number
of lines of code changed in the release has decreased considerably
(about 40%) the project diversity has improved considerably[2].

The Pike release has seen strong contributions from AT&T, Ericsson and
EasyStack (my contributions were split between independent and Verizon
Wireless).

An email discussion on the ML to re-architect Trove[3] resulted in a
good discussion and there was strong support for keeping the current
project going, and there were several promises of participation and we
have some new contributors to the project team.

During the Pike cycle, the project team successfully met the
openstack-wide goal of having all control plane API's via WSGI[4] and
the goal to have voting unit tests for Python3[5,6].

There is good reason therefore, to believe that this phase is a
temporary one, and the project should be able to exit the
maintenance-mode by the end of the Queen cycle.

During the Queen cycle, the project will meet the requirements as
stipulated in[7] as we have been able to during the Pike release.

During the Queen cycle, every effort will be made to meet the cross
project deliverable goals.

At this time there is a commitment that resources will be available to
work on completing any remaining work required to support python3
(there are still some cases where this is not completely working).

There is a clear understanding that the goal to "register and document
policy in code"[8] is one that the project must work to deliver. Every
effort will be made to deliver this but at this time there is no
volunteer who has committed the resources to making this happen.

The goal to 'split tempest plugins into separate repos/projects'[9] is
of dubious value to Trove at this stage and there is currently no one
who has volunteered to do this work. A short lived attempt to remove
the tempest plugin[10] had to be reverted in a hurry[11].

Absent a volunteer to actually perform this work, and further commit
to maintain the independent test suite, it is unlikely that the Trove
project will meet this goal in the Queens cycle.

It is important to reiterate that this goal is one where real
completion is more than just splitting the plugins into another
repository. Admittedly one could meet the letter of the goal by just
spinning out a single test into a new repository and declaring
victory.  That approach, while sufficient to meet the community goal,
is clearly an exercise in futility as was the attempt to eliminate the
tests altogether. Without a contributor who is willing to commit time
to develop, maintain and augment the tests over at least a single
release cycle, it is basically a waste of time to attempt this goal.

For all of these reasons, this request is being made to apply the
status:maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project after a release
candidate for the Pike release has been made, and the tree split has
occurred and master is destined to Queens.

After consultation with the TC, and after demonstrating that the
project has exited the 'transient period of inactivity', and has an
active project team with an active and participating core review
team, a change will be proposed to remove the maintenance-mode tag
from the project.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/449925/
[2] http://stackalytics.com/?metric=commits&release=pike&module=trove-group
[3] http://openstack.markmail.org/thread/2s4gfpzukduazqts
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/455477/
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/454699/
[6] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/454697/
[7] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/tags/status_maintenance-mode.html#requirements
[8] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
[9] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/split-tempest-plugins.html
[10] https://review.openstack.org/437020
[11] https://review.openstack.org/455430

Change-Id: I7fd30908454d9a01b15fd2d661a7b6165778279d
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-29 11:07:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/25b5686b52821cb1eb906963e0e47a34e5cd05e5', 'message': 'Apply (voluntarily) the maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project

occurred and master is destined to Queens.

After consultation with the TC, and after demonstrating that the
project has exited the 'transient period of inactivity', and has an
active project team with an active and participating core review
team, a change will be proposed to remove the maintenance-mode tag
from the project.

'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-09-13 19:20:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/93d77eb2b2b05d55af1ee93d9ad7b8b29d23ee52', 'message': 'Apply (voluntarily) the maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project

This commit is a request to the TC to consider the application of the
maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project.

We are far enough along in the Pike release, and there is sufficient
confidence that the project team will be able to release a version of
Trove as part of the Pike release.

This request is that the maintenance-mode tag be applied to the
project for the reasons described below.

The 'maintenance-mode' tag is meant to signify that a project is in a
transient period of low activity. Here are some numbers that
illustrate this.

Release       LOC
---------------------
IceHouse      43,728
Juno          66,364
Kilo          45,825
Liberty       68,490
Mitaka        74,622
Newton        79,686
Ocata         53,513
Pike          31,150

The reasons for this are well known and I am not going to dwell upon
them here; they were the subject of discussion when the tag was
proposed [1], and when it was discussed by the TC.

When this tag was created, it had been the plan that it would
immediately be applied to the Trove project but after discussing this
with several people in the community, it was agreed that we would wait
a release cycle and see what if anything changed during that period of
time.

While the number of commits has decreased (about 50%), and the number
of lines of code changed in the release has decreased considerably
(about 40%) the project diversity has improved considerably[2].

The Pike release has seen strong contributions from AT&T, Ericsson and
EasyStack (my contributions were split between independent and Verizon
Wireless).

An email discussion on the ML to re-architect Trove[3] resulted in a
good discussion and there was strong support for keeping the current
project going, and there were several promises of participation and we
have some new contributors to the project team.

During the Pike cycle, the project team successfully met the
openstack-wide goal of having all control plane API's via WSGI[4] and
the goal to have voting unit tests for Python3[5,6].

There is good reason therefore, to believe that this phase is a
temporary one, and the project should be able to exit the
maintenance-mode by the end of the Queen cycle.

During the Queen cycle, the project will meet the requirements as
stipulated in[7] as we have been able to during the Pike release.

During the Queen cycle, every effort will be made to meet the cross
project deliverable goals.

At this time there is a commitment that resources will be available to
work on completing any remaining work required to support python3
(there are still some cases where this is not completely working).

There is a clear understanding that the goal to "register and document
policy in code"[8] is one that the project must work to deliver. Every
effort will be made to deliver this but at this time there is no
volunteer who has committed the resources to making this happen.

The goal to 'split tempest plugins into separate repos/projects'[9] is
of dubious value to Trove at this stage and there is currently no one
who has volunteered to do this work. A short lived attempt to remove
the tempest plugin[10] had to be reverted in a hurry[11].

Absent a volunteer to actually perform this work, and further commit
to maintain the independent test suite, it is unlikely that the Trove
project will meet this goal in the Queens cycle.

It is important to reiterate that this goal is one where real
completion is more than just splitting the plugins into another
repository. Admittedly one could meet the letter of the goal by just
spinning out a single test into a new repository and declaring
victory.  That approach, while sufficient to meet the community goal,
is clearly an exercise in futility as was the attempt to eliminate the
tests altogether. Without a contributor who is willing to commit time
to develop, maintain and augment the tests over at least a single
release cycle, it is basically a waste of time to attempt this goal.

For all of these reasons, this request is being made to apply the
status:maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project after a release
candidate for the Pike release has been made, and the tree split has
occurred and master is destined to Queens.

After consultation with the TC, and after demonstrating that the
project has exited the 'transient period of inactivity', and has an
active project team with an active and participating core review
team, a change will be proposed to remove the maintenance-mode tag
from the project.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/449925/
[2] http://stackalytics.com/?metric=commits&release=pike&module=trove-group
[3] http://openstack.markmail.org/thread/2s4gfpzukduazqts
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/455477/
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/454699/
[6] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/454697/
[7] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/tags/status_maintenance-mode.html#requirements
[8] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
[9] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/split-tempest-plugins.html
[10] https://review.openstack.org/437020
[11] https://review.openstack.org/455430

Change-Id: I7fd30908454d9a01b15fd2d661a7b6165778279d

commit_message:
Apply (voluntarily) the maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project

This commit is a request to the TC to consider the application of the
maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project.

We are far enough along in the Pike release, and there is sufficient
confidence that the project team will be able to release a version of
Trove as part of the Pike release.

This request is that the maintenance-mode tag be applied to the
project for the reasons described below.

The 'maintenance-mode' tag is meant to signify that a project is in a
transient period of low activity. Here are some numbers that
illustrate this.

Release       LOC
---------------------
IceHouse      43,728
Juno          66,364
Kilo          45,825
Liberty       68,490
Mitaka        74,622
Newton        79,686
Ocata         53,513
Pike          31,150

The reasons for this are well known and I am not going to dwell upon
them here; they were the subject of discussion when the tag was
proposed [1], and when it was discussed by the TC.

When this tag was created, it had been the plan that it would
immediately be applied to the Trove project but after discussing this
with several people in the community, it was agreed that we would wait
a release cycle and see what if anything changed during that period of
time.

While the number of commits has decreased (about 50%), and the number
of lines of code changed in the release has decreased considerably
(about 40%) the project diversity has improved considerably[2].

The Pike release has seen strong contributions from AT&T, Ericsson and
EasyStack (my contributions were split between independent and Verizon
Wireless).

An email discussion on the ML to re-architect Trove[3] resulted in a
good discussion and there was strong support for keeping the current
project going, and there were several promises of participation and we
have some new contributors to the project team.

During the Pike cycle, the project team successfully met the
openstack-wide goal of having all control plane API's via WSGI[4] and
the goal to have voting unit tests for Python3[5,6].

There is good reason therefore, to believe that this phase is a
temporary one, and the project should be able to exit the
maintenance-mode by the end of the Queen cycle.

During the Queen cycle, the project will meet the requirements as
stipulated in[7] as we have been able to during the Pike release.

During the Queen cycle, every effort will be made to meet the cross
project deliverable goals.

At this time there is a commitment that resources will be available to
work on completing any remaining work required to support python3
(there are still some cases where this is not completely working).

There is a clear understanding that the goal to "register and document
policy in code"[8] is one that the project must work to deliver. Every
effort will be made to deliver this but at this time there is no
volunteer who has committed the resources to making this happen.

The goal to 'split tempest plugins into separate repos/projects'[9] is
of dubious value to Trove at this stage and there is currently no one
who has volunteered to do this work. A short lived attempt to remove
the tempest plugin[10] had to be reverted in a hurry[11].

Absent a volunteer to actually perform this work, and further commit
to maintain the independent test suite, it is unlikely that the Trove
project will meet this goal in the Queens cycle.

It is important to reiterate that this goal is one where real
completion is more than just splitting the plugins into another
repository. Admittedly one could meet the letter of the goal by just
spinning out a single test into a new repository and declaring
victory.  That approach, while sufficient to meet the community goal,
is clearly an exercise in futility as was the attempt to eliminate the
tests altogether. Without a contributor who is willing to commit time
to develop, maintain and augment the tests over at least a single
release cycle, it is basically a waste of time to attempt this goal.

For all of these reasons, this request is being made to apply the
status:maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project after a release
candidate for the Pike release has been made, and the tree split has
occurred and master is destined to Queens.

After consultation with the TC, and after demonstrating that the
project has exited the 'transient period of inactivity', and has an
active project team with an active and participating core review
team, a change will be proposed to remove the maintenance-mode tag
from the project.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/449925/
[2] http://stackalytics.com/?metric=commits&release=pike&module=trove-group
[3] http://openstack.markmail.org/thread/2s4gfpzukduazqts
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/455477/
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/454699/
[6] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/454697/
[7] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/tags/status_maintenance-mode.html#requirements
[8] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
[9] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/split-tempest-plugins.html
[10] https://review.openstack.org/437020
[11] https://review.openstack.org/455430

commit_message:
Rename option '--rm' to '--auto-remove'

I think the new option name '--auto-remove' is self-explanatory.
Also, the name style is more consistent with other options (prefer
full name to acronym).

commit_message:
drop driver and topic settings in designate ctx

A similar change will land in designate to drop this extra topic as
well.

Also, driver and topic overrides in a service-specific context are not a
good idea.

Change-Id: I804a34fb044090010ecfd2560594cc1f55e9bd21
Closes-Bug: #1710831
Closes-Bug: #1738100
(cherry picked from commit b89de21d47dc9114d20456452cd867041bcd83c5)

subject: Minimize the effect overloaded Health Manager processes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-03 20:38:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/72fbea4cdb9d84cd7ccd0e048d338a27307bc6fd', 'message': "Minimize the effect overloaded Health Manager processes

If a Health Manager is overloaded, it can begin to fall very far behind
in processing health updates. This causes huge delays in the whole
system and can cause two distinctly different issues:

1) If the HMs are all suddenly busy, delays can be long enough that no
messages get through within the failover timeout, and amps start to
fail, increasing load on the HMs and causing a cascade failure (I have
witnessed this happen once and take down over 50 LBs before manual
intervention could be taken)..

2) Even one overloaded HM can cause updates to queue for extremely long
periods, which makes the system unreliable. Amps can go down and still
have health updates register for some time as the HM processes the queue
(in some cases I have seen dead amps updated for 5-10 minutes).

If we short-circuit handling before we update the health table, we can
solve these problems in two ways:

1) The heavy processing generally happens after this, so
short-circuiting early will let some other threads finish faster and
have some chance of success.

2) Amphora health won't continue to be updated long after the messages
were received, so it won't be possible for zombie amphorae to eat as
many brains.

Change-Id: Iceeacfdcaebe1f9bb99bc08e318c9da73a66898d

periods, which makes the system unreliable. Amps can go down and still
have health updates register for some time as the HM processes the queue
(in some cases I have seen dead amps updated for 5-10 minutes).

If we short-circuit handling before we update the health table, we can
solve these problems in two ways:

1) The heavy processing generally happens after this, so
short-circuiting early will let some other threads finish faster and
have some chance of success.

2) Amphora health won't continue to be updated long after the messages

commit_message:
Minimize the effect overloaded Health Manager processes

If a Health Manager is overloaded, it can begin to fall very far behind
in processing health updates. This causes huge delays in the whole
system and can cause two distinctly different issues:

1) If the HMs are all suddenly busy, delays can be long enough that no
messages get through within the failover timeout, and amps start to
fail, increasing load on the HMs and causing a cascade failure (I have
witnessed this happen once and take down over 50 LBs before manual
intervention could be taken)..

2) Even one overloaded HM can cause updates to queue for extremely long
periods, which makes the system unreliable. Amps can go down and still
have health updates register for some time as the HM processes the queue
(in some cases I have seen dead amps updated for 5-10 minutes).

If we short-circuit handling before we update the health table, we can
solve these problems in two ways:

1) The heavy processing generally happens after this, so
short-circuiting early will let some other threads finish faster and
have some chance of success.

2) Amphora health won't continue to be updated long after the messages
were received, so it won't be possible for zombie amphorae to eat as
many brains.

Change-Id: Iceeacfdcaebe1f9bb99bc08e318c9da73a66898d

subject: Use keystone.common.provider_api for identity APIs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-27 16:23:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/b01032e2d95294c540d8f2900fa96823d57644ba', 'message': 'Use keystone.common.provider_api for identity APIs

This change converts the usage of self.<provider_api> to

commit_message:
Use keystone.common.provider_api for identity APIs

This change converts the usage of self.<provider_api> to
keystone.common.providers_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> in manager
and controller logic. This is the correct way to reference
providers from other managers and controllers now that dependency
injection has been eliminated.

Change-Id: I4c9428f916fd28ee6df701aee26c5e2c516c4913

commit_message:
FIP: update_floatingip_status() to return the updated object

Prior to this patch the update_floatingip_status() method didn't have a
return value. This patch changes that by returning the updated version
of the floating ip upon update success, just like any other update()
method.

This is important in certain situations because,
update_floatingip_status() bumps the ``revision_number`` of the FIP.
Drivers like networking-ovn (and potentially others) does track those
revision numbers updates as a way to ensure that the SDN database is up
to date with the Neutron database.

Change-Id: Ic261e91761ff8715c227f5213870d2db014355c8

commit_message:
Use ipv6 network templates from tripleo-heat-templates

Update quickstart ovb-ha (ipv6) jobs to use the network templates and
environments from tripleo-heat-templates instead of tripleo-ci. This
allows for having per-branch differences between the templates.

The net-iso.yaml environment from tripleo-ci is uneeded as it's
parameters are also set in network-environment.yaml, so it's usage is
removed.

Change-Id: I18b3bea25cd02682d3c58d665d234f7938e38856

commit_message:
Add a test case for populate_from_iterable()

There is no unit test of populate_from_iterable function for the
case that the parent is already in provider tree and update it at
the same time we add the child for that parent.

So this patch adds that test case.

Change-Id: If2bcefd74f51d0d0bc32eee54494dcaeea8bcbae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/35/530035/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_populate_from_iterable_with_root_update(self): pt = provider_tree.ProviderTree() # Let's create a root plist = [ { 'uuid': uuids.root, 'name': 'root', 'generation': 0, }, ] pt.populate_from_iterable(plist) expected_uuids = set([uuids.root]) self.assertEqual(expected_uuids, pt.get_provider_uuids()) # Let's add a child updating the name and generation for the root. # root # +-> child1 plist = [ { 'uuid': uuids.root, 'name': 'root_with_new_name', 'generation': 1, }, { 'uuid': uuids.child1, 'name': 'child1', 'generation': 1, 'parent_provider_uuid': uuids.root, }, ] pt.populate_from_iterable(plist) # (tetsuro) We are expecting 2 rps, but updating the root *sometimes* # deletes his child. Please run this locally. # expected_uuids = set([uuids.root, uuids.child1]) expected_uuids = set([uuids.root]) self.assertEqual(expected_uuids, pt.get_provider_uuids())

commit_message:
Support policy.yaml file for Aodh

This will copy both of yaml or json policy file
if it exists

Change-Id: Ie5e03e0307d239f1079d2522e353367f7f954e77
Implements: blueprint support-custom-policy-yaml
Co-authored-By: Duong Ha-Quang <duonghq@vn.fujitsu.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/65/514565/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/aodh-api/wjsonsgi-aodh.conf" vars: format: "{{ item }}" local_action: stat path="{{ node_custom_config }}/aodh/policy.{{ format }}" with_items: "{ policy_format_list }}" dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/{{ item[0].key }}/policy.{{ item[1].value }}" - item[1].stat.exists - inventory_hostname in groups[item[0].value.group] - item[0].value.enabled | bool with_dict: - "{{ aodh_services }}" - "{{ aodh_policy.results }}"
deleted_lines: dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/aodh-api/wsgi-aodh.conf" local_action: stat path="{{ node_custom_config }}/aodh/policy.json" dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/{{ item.key }}/policy.json" - aodh_policy.stat.exists - inventory_hostname in groups[item.value.group] - item.value.enabled | bool with_dict: "{{ aodh_services }}"

commit_message:
Remove function optimize_db_test_loader in test_base.py

optimize_db_test_loader is replaced by optimize_package_test_loader
in test_fixtures.py.So this function is deprecated for removal.

Change-Id: I12cdf846f1e23d74ae8a87bea33fbc8477974bfc
Closes-Bug:#1715572
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db refs/changes/16/501616/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: from oslo_db.sqlalchemy import test_base as legacy_test_base def test_package_level_legacy(self): self._test_package_level(legacy_test_base.optimize_db_test_loader)

subject: Add attach/detach security group action to neutron driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-30 03:54:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/congress/commit/8bd797242bf7dcfc3bee0943d0c9e73d91ece215', 'message': 'Add attach/detach security group action to neutron driver

To modify the security groups attached to the list through congress
policy, actions to attach/detach a security group to/from port is
needed.

Because the neutron v2 API and client do not support attach/detach
of a single security group, but only the replacement of the entire
security group list, we add these custom actions which combine
a read and update action to accomplish the attach/detach.

Caveat: Another concurrent update to the list of attached ports may
be lost. Unfortunately, there is simply no better solution given the
limitations of the neutron v2 API. So we enable these actions anyway
with documented warning in the driver actions description.

Change-Id: I51ec7452a5a7a77cc8cfc57b87e671685280ea73
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-10-13 17:56:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/congress/commit/6544399ea588274de73507d12e92edaf0f5e626e', 'message': 'Add attach/detach security group action to neutron driver

commit_message:
Add attach/detach security group action to neutron driver

To modify the security groups attached to the list through congress
policy, actions to attach/detach a security group to/from port is
needed.

Because the neutron v2 API and client do not support attach/detach
of a single security group, but only the replacement of the entire
security group list, we add these custom actions which combine
a read and update action to accomplish the attach/detach.

Caveat: Another concurrent update to the list of attached ports may
be lost. Unfortunately, there is simply no better solution given the
limitations of the neutron v2 API. So we enable these actions anyway
with documented warning in the driver actions description.

Change-Id: I51ec7452a5a7a77cc8cfc57b87e671685280ea73

[], u'binding:host_id': u'devstack', u'binding:profile': {}, u'binding:vif_details': { u'ovs_hybrid_plug': True, u'port_filter': True }, u'binding:vif_type': u'ovs', u'binding:vnic_type': u'normal', u'dns_assignment': { u'hostname': u'myport', u'ip_address': u'10.0.0.1', u'fqdn': u'myport.my-domain.org' }, u'dns_domain': u'my-domain.org.', u'dns_name': u'myport', u'extra_dhcp_opts': [], u'fixed_ips': [ { u'ip_address': u'10.0.0.1', u'subnet_id': u'a0304c3a-4f08-4c43-88af-d796509c97d2' } ], u'id': u'46d4bfb9-b26e-41f3-bd2e-e6dcc1ccedb2', u'mac_address': u'fa:16:3e:23:fd:d7', u'name': u'', u'network_id': u'a87cc70a-3e15-4acf-8205-9b711a3531b7', u'port_security_enabled': True, u'project_id': u'7e02058126cc4950b75f9970368ba177', u'revision_number': 1, u'security_groups': [u'e0239062-4243-4798-865f-7055f03786d6'], u'status': u'ACTIVE', u'tenant_id': u'7e02058126cc4950b75f9970368ba177', u'updated_at': u'2016-03-08T20:19:41' } } port_id = new_sgroup_id]} existing_sgroup_args = {'positional': [port_id, existing_sgroup_id]} with mock.patch.object(self.driver.neutron, "show_port", return_value=deepcopy(port_info)): with mock.patch.object(self.driver.neutron, "update_port") as mock_update_port: self.driver.attach_port_security_group(new_sgroup_args) self.assertEqual(mock_update_port.call_count, 1) mock_update_port.assert_called_with( port_id, {'port': {'security_groups': [existing_sgroup_id, new_sgroup_id]}}) with mock.patch.object(self.driver.neutron, "show_port", return_value=deepcopy(port_info)): with mock.patch.object(self.driver.neutron, "update_port") as mock_update_port: self.driver.attach_port_security_group(existing_sgroup_args) self.assertEqual(mock_update_port.call_count, 0) with mock.patch.object(self.driver.neutron, "show_port", return_value=deepcopy(port_info)): with mock.patch.object(self.driver.neutron, "update_port") as mock_update_port: self.driver.detach_port_security_group(new_sgroup_args) self.assertEqual(mock_update_port.call_count, 0) with mock.patch.object(self.driver.neutron, "show_port", return_value=deepcopy(port_info)): with mock.patch.object(self.driver.neutron, "update_port") as mock_update_port: self.driver.detach_port_security_group(existing_sgroup_args) self.assertEqual(mock_update_port.call_count, 1) mock_update_port.assert_called_with( port_id, {'port': {'security_groups': []}})

python-subunit is not used directly anywhere
and it is dependency of both testrepository and os-testr
(probably was used by some tox wrapper script before)

commit_message:
Add search_opts in func list of ManagerWithFind type classes

In patch I96339778fa69c379863078250d5dfa7172f2c1b2, it called
self.list with search_opts, but some subclasses of ManagerWithFind
do not have search_opts in function list, this make some list
functions and show by name functions fail and throw 'unexpected
keyword argument search_opts' error. This patch will fix it.

Change-Id: Ic4b65c0e5900a0e3e19155d5d9d42d5063c3137d
Closes-Bug: #1738917
Closes-Bug: #1738918

commit_message:
WIP: MairaDB: take ownership of entrypoint script

It has been observed that the MariaDB entrypoint script does
not always init the container in time, and also returns occasional
false +ves for having performed the init. See:
 * https://github.com/docker-library/mariadb/blob/master/docker-entrypoint.sh#L100-L106

Change-Id: I2b5aaa6a733d566536068b3bacad5a9f017f45e6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/69/531269/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: mariadb-bin mountPath: /tmp/docker-entrypoint.sh subPath: docker-entrypoint.sh readOnly: true

commit_message:
Add Grafana chart to OSH infra

Moves the grafana chart to OSH infra along with basic rbac rules
that may be tightened with future work.

Change-Id: Ie14627530a73d4b7b01eb93ca5f7174d99d9caec

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/18/530318/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Deploy a QoS awared load balancer --------------------------------- This is the solution about load balancing traffic is limited by the underlay network's bandwidth. So Load Balancer can accept the Qos Policy from Neutron, then make the vip of Load Balancer ingoing or outgoing traffic. **Scenario description**: * Qos-policy created from neutron with bandwidth-limit-rules by us. * Back-end servers 192.0.2.10 and 192.0.2.11 on subnet *private-subnet* have been configured with an HTTP application on TCP port 80. * Subnet *public-subnet* is a shared external subnet created by the cloud operator which is reachable from the internet. * We want to configure a basic load balancer and want to limit the traffic bandwidth when web traffic requests the vip. **Solution**: 1. Create qos policy *qos-policy-bandwidth* with *bandwidth_limit* in Neutron. 2. Create load balancer *lb1* on subnet *public-subnet* with the id of *qos-policy-bandwidth* 3. Create listener *listener1*. 4. Create pool *pool1* as *listener1*'s default pool. 5. Add members 192.0.2.10 and 192.0.2.11 on *private-subnet* to *pool1*. **CLI commands**: :: openstack network qos policy create qos-policy-bandwidth openstack network qos rule create --type bandwidth_limit --max-kbps 1024 --max-burst-kbits 1024 --ingress qos-policy-bandwidth neutron lbaas-loadbalancer-create --name lb1 public-subnet --vip-qos-policy-id <qos_policy_bandwidth_id> # Re-run the following until lb1 shows ACTIVE and ONLINE statuses: neutron lbaas-loadbalancer-show lb1 neutron lbaas-listener-create --name listener1 --loadbalancer lb1 --protocol HTTP --protocol-port 80 neutron lbaas-pool-create --name pool1 --lb-algorithm ROUND_ROBIN --listener listener1 --protocol HTTP neutron lbaas-member-create --subnet private-subnet --address 192.0.2.10 --protocol-port 80 pool1 neutron lbaas-member-create --subnet private-subnet --address 192.0.2.11 --protocol-port 80 pool1

commit_message:
Fix retrieving barbican endpoint from service catalog

The context wrapper classes under castellan.common.credentials were
missing an auth_url property resulting in calls to get_endpoint()
failing with 'Could not determine a suitable URL for the plugin' unless
users set barbican/auth_endpoint.

Change-Id: I1be3a1e11e3f4c2170062927ad359bf679eb25d9
Closes-Bug: #1497993
(cherry picked from commit 17e8b29067e93dbe5f13d0d18e62b06fcd148d3f)

This patch is saving the revision number from the Neutron network object
into OVNDB and using it for checking for correctness when updating the
OVN resource.

Updates with a lower revision number will be skipped ensuring that we
don't overwrite a newer object with an old one if updates are out of order
(due to the postcommit() design).

Change-Id: Ie817a559bd708f6601d7004187f0f088e8b09b47

This patch is saving the revision number from the Neutron network object
into OVNDB and using it for checking for correctness when updating the
OVN resource.

The "original_network" parameter has been removed from the
update_network() methods. Since the stragey here is to drop patches with
older revision numbers we won't be creating a delta between two neutron
versions anymore. Instead, we will always make sure that OVN is sync'd
with what is latest in Neutron.

commit_message:
Check for correctness when updating networks

This patch is saving the revision number from the Neutron network object
into OVNDB and using it for checking for correctness when updating the
OVN resource.

The "original_network" parameter has been removed from the
update_network() methods. Since the stragey here is to drop patches with
older revision numbers we won't be creating a delta between two neutron
versions anymore. Instead, we will always make sure that OVN is sync'd
with what is latest in Neutron.

Partial-Bug: #1605089
Change-Id: Ie817a559bd708f6601d7004187f0f088e8b09b47
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/49/517049/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from networking_ovn.common import exceptionsRESOURCE_TYPE_MAP = { ovn_const.TYPE_NETWORKS: 'Logical_Switch', } class CheckRevisionNumberCommand(command.BaseCommand): def __init__(self, api, name, resource, resource_type): super(CheckRevisionNumberCommand, self).__init__(api) self.name = name self.resource = resource self.resource_type = resource_type def run_idl(self, txn): try: ovn_resource = idlutils.row_by_value( self.api.idl, RESOURCE_TYPE_MAP[self.resource_type], 'name', self.name) except idlutils.RowNotFound: msg = (_('Failed to check the revision number for %s: Resource ' 'does not exist') % self.name) raise RuntimeError(msg) external_ids = getattr(ovn_resource, 'external_ids', {}) ovn_revision = int(external_ids.get( ovn_const.OVN_REV_NUM_EXT_ID_KEY, -1)) neutron_revision = self.resource['revision_number'] if ovn_revision >= neutron_revision: raise exceptions.TransactionAborted( 'OVN revision number for %s is equal or higher ' 'than the given resource. Aborting update' % self.name) ovn_resource.verify('external_ids') external_ids[ovn_const.OVN_REV_NUM_EXT_ID_KEY] = str(neutron_revision) ovn_resource.external_ids = external_ids

commit_message:
Add PTL Election Dates to Schedule

This patch adds a new item to the schedule: email
deadline. It then adds that item, along with ptl nominatons
and ptl elections to the official schedule.

Change-Id: I433c4c51564ec0cd95302a1a14071c23a2bceba5

commit_message:
Fix exception when querying for non-existing items

An IndexError exception is raised when trying to get non-existing and
unique item resources via Neutron network driver.

Even though the exception is caught and raises a base.NetworkException
exception, it should raise an exception from
neutron_client_exceptions.NotFound instead.

Story: 2001424
Task: 6130

Change-Id: I0e99e846bb58b88d98598f2f2b52c7c1f8ea0967

commit_message:
Improve user error messages for duplicate objects

The error handling for duplicate records was not great, specifically
health monitors would return a 500 or a 409 with a bad error message.
This patch improves the errors the user gets back when creating a
duplicate entity.

Co-Authored-By: Jacky Hu <hudayou@hotmail.com>
Change-Id: I03ec527b42d67427541121e59e4433699e04aab8

commit_message:
Modify node name from oldnode to newnode in basics doc

There is no node named oldnode, we can delete the node named newnode
that joined the cluster in the previous setps.

Change-Id: I2cf5baba0e44bf4b2c15c6ea404b88c0e079a419
Signed-off-by: blkart <blkart.org@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/40/531140/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $ openstack cluster members del --nodes newnode mycluster $ openstack cluster node show newnode
deleted_lines: $ openstack cluster members del --nodes oldnode mycluster $ openstack cluster node show oldnode

commit_message:
Handle InvalidScope exception from oslo.policy

oslo.policy has the ability to check the scope of the request
against the scope of the operation and it will throw an InvalidScope
exception if they don't match. If we catch this exception, we should
throw a Forbidden instead because the caller doesn't have the
necessary role on the intended scope to perform the action.

Change-Id: I8805db48b2ce82397ce70cdb4d6b6d8178603339
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/63/530263/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: return _ENFORCER.enforce(action, target, credentials, **extra) except common_policy.InvalidScope: raise exception.ForbiddenAction(action=action)

commit_message:
Use keystone.common.provider_api directly in assignment

Convert use of self.<provider_api> to
keystone.common.provider_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> for manager
calls. This is the correct way to reference managers now now that
the dependency injection has been eliminated.

Change-Id: I8e8431750486fc125e277c90557040c11c5802e9

keystone.common.providers_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> in manager
and controller logic. This is the correct way to reference
providers from other managers and controllers now that dependency
injection has been eliminated.

commit_message:
Use keystone.common.provider_api for endpoint_policy APIs

This change converts the usage of self.<provider_api> to
keystone.common.providers_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> in manager
and controller logic. This is the correct way to reference
providers from other managers and controllers now that dependency
injection has been eliminated.

Change-Id: Ic38ee0128b6a5a486ab9854c4e331d6df62c5cb9

Change-Id: I84ec240922c85d616aa0b15b1fa7dcad5455e6eb

commit_message:
Use keystone.common.provider_api for credential APIs

This change converts the usage of self.<provider_api> to
keystone.common.providers_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> in manager
and controller logic. This is the correct way to reference
providers from other managers and controllers now that dependency
injection has been eliminated.

Change-Id: I84ec240922c85d616aa0b15b1fa7dcad5455e6eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/34/530234/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines: --- - name: Ensuring config directories exist file: path: "{{ node_config_directory }}/{{ item.key }}" state: "directory" recurse: yes when: inventory_hostname in groups[item.value.group] with_dict: "{{ vitrage_services }}" - name: Copying over config.json files for services template: src: "{{ item.key }}.json.j2" dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/{{ item.key }}/config.json" register: vitrage_config_jsons when: - inventory_hostname in groups[item.value.group] - item.value.enabled | bool with_dict: "{{ vitrage_services }}" notify: - Restart vitrage-api container - Restart vitrage-notifier container - Restart vitrage-graph container - name: Copying over vitrage.conf merge_configs: vars: service_name: "{{ item.key }}" sources: - "{{ role_path }}/templates/vitrage.conf.j2" - "{{ node_config_directory }}/config/global.conf" - "{{ node_config_directory }}/config/messaging.conf" - "{{ node_config_directory }}/config/vitrage.conf" - "{{ node_config_directory }}/config/vitrage/{{ item.key }}.conf" - "{{ node_config_directory }}/config/vitrage/{{ inventory_hostname }}/vitrage.conf" dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/{{ item.key }}/vitrage.conf" register: vitrage_confs when: - inventory_hostname in groups[item.value.group] - item.value.enabled | bool with_dict: "{{ vitrage_services }}" notify: - Restart vitrage-api container - Restart vitrage-notifier container - Restart vitrage-graph container - name: Check if policies shall be overwritten local_action: stat path="{{ node_custom_config }}/vitrage/policy.json" register: vitrage_policy - name: Copying over existing policy.json template: src: "{{ node_custom_config }}/vitrage/policy.json" dest: "{{ node_config_directory }}/{{ item.key }}/policy.json" register: vitrage_policy_jsons when: - commit_message:
Use keystone.common.provider_api for token APIs

This change converts the usage of self.<provider_api> to
keystone.common.providers_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> in manager
and controller logic. This is the correct way to reference
providers from other managers and controllers now that dependency
injection has been eliminated.

Change-Id: I853dd2d1fec159316b3101750b87aae9368bac58

subject: Handle InvalidVolume when creating a volume attachment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-04 23:48:10.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/v3/attachments.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/v3/test_attachments.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/dfe2608a99c5e40fff8bdfeddab92e6543b4aa78', 'message': "Handle InvalidVolume when creating a volume attachment

If you try to attach a non-multiattach volume to more than
once instance using the 3.27 volume attachments API, the volume
API would return a 500 response because the volume is in-use.

This translates to a 500 in the compute API because nova isn't
expecting a random client exception.

Treat this like how os-reserve could fail in the same situation
and handle InvalidVolume which will be converted to an HTTPBadRequest
by ResourceExceptionHandler elsewhere in the WSGi stack.

Change-Id: I1a8068043159b034d700419675af87fc17e1faf5
Closes-Bug: #1741112
(cherry picked from commit 727e334950c672b9309ad6a1394488dbdc13952f)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle InvalidVolume when creating a volume attachment

If you try to attach a non-multiattach volume to more than
once instance using the 3.27 volume attachments API, the volume
API would return a 500 response because the volume is in-use.

This translates to a 500 in the compute API because nova isn't
expecting a random client exception.

Treat this like how os-reserve could fail in the same situation
and handle InvalidVolume which will be converted to an HTTPBadRequest
by ResourceExceptionHandler elsewhere in the WSGi stack.

Change-Id: I1a8068043159b034d700419675af87fc17e1faf5
Closes-Bug: #1741112
(cherry picked from commit 727e334950c672b9309ad6a1394488dbdc13952f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/65/531265/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('cinder.volume.api.API._attachment_reserve') def test_create_attachment_in_use_volume_multiattach_false(self, mock_reserve): """Negative test for creating an attachment on an in-use volume.""" req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('/v3/%s/attachments' % fake.PROJECT_ID, version=mv.NEW_ATTACH) body = { "attachment": { "connector": None, "instance_uuid": fake.UUID1, "volume_uuid": self.volume1.id }, } mock_reserve.side_effect = ( exception.InvalidVolume( reason="Volume %s status must be available or " "downloading" % self.volume1.id)) # Note that if we were using the full WSGi stack, the # ResourceExceptionHandler would convert this to an HTTPBadRequest. self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidVolume, self.controller.create, req, body=body)

subject: gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade workflow fix
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-14 20:37:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/48ba508481f8fc124a4fb9c607b5ad36224fa2cb', 'message': "gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade workflow fix

The current workflow for gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade doesn't
work well with swift backend.

Notification agent push data into Gnocchi on step4, but
Ceilometer-upgrade run only on step5, So Gnocchi have not been populated
with latest resource schemas.

Gnocchi-api is started in step3 but gnocchi::storage configuration have
not been done and database upgrade have not been done.

This change will fix this issue by:

* Doing only the Gnocchi database upgrade on step3.
* Configuring gnocchi::storage on step3.
* Doing the remaining storage/incoming upgrade of Gnocchi on step4 when
  swift is ready.
* We can do ceilometer-upgrade at step4, without waiting for swift to
  be ready

This ensures:

* gnocchi-api will be correctly configured at the end of
  step3 (configuration+database-sync).
* No new measures will be pushed to Gnocchi before ceilometer-upgrade have
  upgraded the Gnocchi resource schemas.
* Gnocchi-api have database updated before ceilometer-upgrade need it.
* We continue to upgrade storage/incoming data of Gnocchi on step4 after
  swift is up.

Closes-bug: #1724328
Change-Id: I3f9a784e507e03454b335ba8319601fba208ba0a
(cherry picked from commit 4e6939c1a874a06f336321a9d44d9991872f74cf)

The current workflow for gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade doesn't
work well with swift backend.

Notification agent push data into Gnocchi on step4, but
Ceilometer-upgrade run only on step5, So Gnocchi have not been populated
with latest resource schemas.

Gnocchi-api is started in step3 but gnocchi::storage configuration have
not been done and database upgrade have not been done.

When configuration is done on step4, httpd will be restarted.

This change will fix this issue by:

* Doing only the Gnocchi database upgrade on step3 because swift is
  ready only on step4.
* Configuring gnocchi::storage on step3 to avoid gnocchi-api restart on
  step4.
* Move ceilometer-notification on step4 to ensure ceilometer-upgrade
  have been run.

This ensures:

* gnocchi-api will be correctly configured at the end of
  step3 (configuration+database-sync).
* No new measures will be pushed to Gnocchi before ceilometer-upgrade have
  upgraded the Gnocchi resource schemas.
* Gnocchi-api have database updated before ceilometer-upgrade need it.
* We continue to upgrade storage/incoming data of Gnocchi on step4 after
  swift is up.

Closes-bug: #1724328
Change-Id: I3f9a784e507e03454b335ba8319601fba208ba0a
(cherry picked from commit 4e6939c1a874a06f336321a9d44d9991872f74cf)

When configuration is done on step4, httpd will be restarted.

This change will fix this issue by:

* Doing only the Gnocchi database upgrade on step3 because swift is
  ready only on step4.
* Configuring gnocchi::storage on step3 to avoid gnocchi-api restart on
  step4.
* Move ceilometer-notification on step4 to ensure ceilometer-upgrade
  have been run.

This ensures:

* gnocchi-api will be correctly configured at the end of
  step3 (configuration+database-sync).
* No new measures will be pushed to Gnocchi before ceilometer-upgrade have
  upgraded the Gnocchi resource schemas.
* Gnocchi-api have database updated before ceilometer-upgrade need it.
* We continue to upgrade storage/incoming data of Gnocchi on step4 after
  swift is up.

Closes-bug: #1724328
Change-Id: I3f9a784e507e03454b335ba8319601fba208ba0a
(cherry picked from commit 4e6939c1a874a06f336321a9d44d9991872f74cf)

commit_message:
gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade workflow fix

The current workflow for gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade doesn't
work well with swift backend.

Notification agent push data into Gnocchi on step4, but
Ceilometer-upgrade run only on step5, So Gnocchi have not been populated
with latest resource schemas.

Gnocchi-api is started in step3 but gnocchi::storage configuration have
not been done and database upgrade have not been done.

When configuration is done on step4, httpd will be restarted.

This change will fix this issue by:

* Doing only the Gnocchi database upgrade on step3 because swift is
  ready only on step4.
* Configuring gnocchi::storage on step3 to avoid gnocchi-api restart on
  step4.
* Move ceilometer-notification on step4 to ensure ceilometer-upgrade
  have been run.

This ensures:

* gnocchi-api will be correctly configured at the end of
  step3 (configuration+database-sync).
* No new measures will be pushed to Gnocchi before ceilometer-upgrade have
  upgraded the Gnocchi resource schemas.
* Gnocchi-api have database updated before ceilometer-upgrade need it.
* We continue to upgrade storage/incoming data of Gnocchi on step4 after
  swift is up.

Closes-bug: #1724328
Change-Id: I3f9a784e507e03454b335ba8319601fba208ba0a
(cherry picked from commit 4e6939c1a874a06f336321a9d44d9991872f74cf)

deleted_lines: if $step >= 4 and $sync_db { include ::gnocchi::db::sync } if $step >= 4 or ($step >= 3 and $sync_db) { } if $step >= 4 {

Update the shade-merge document

There are a few more discussions that have been had that have not been
captured. Capture them.

Change-Id: Ie1422bc9a48b600c61d8c906cdfaf9fe4d26c924
